titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Ashman papers, 1781-1784
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: The papers deal with the problems of raising troops, securing money for payment, and obtaining adequate military equipment and food supplies. While the state militia was employed in service to the newly-formed United States, county defense was also frequently discussed.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: George Ashman Papers, 1781-1784, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Revolutionary War soldier (Militia Lieutenant), of Bedford County, Pa.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The papers deal with the problems of raising troops, securing money for payment, and obtaining adequate military equipment and food supplies. While the state militia was employed in service to the newly-formed United States, county defense was also frequently discussed.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Continental Army -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc
controlaccess.geogname: United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783 -- Equipment and supplies
